item.title: 科技股引领亚洲股市反弹，黄金因美联储降息押注接近纪录高位
item.description: 周四，科技股大涨，推动亚洲股指走高，而黄金则徘徊在纪录高点附近，美元则因美国劳动力市场报告疲软支撑了对美联储降息的押注而萎靡不振。【原文：Tech shares rallied on Thursday, driving Asia stock indexes higher, while gold hovered near a record high and the dollar languished as a weak U.S. labour market report bolstered bets for Federal Reserve interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 黄金出口锐减，澳大利亚贸易顺差大幅缩水
item.description: 周四的数据显示，澳大利亚 8 月份的货物贸易顺差大幅缩减，原因是黄金出货量在连续几个月的强劲增长后大幅下滑，而进口量则全面增长。【原文：Australia's surplus on goods trade shrank sharply in August as shipments of gold plunged after a run of strong months, data showed on Thursday, while imports were up across the board.】

item.title: 俄罗斯原油制裁有望收紧，原油从 16 周低点反弹
item.description: 油价周四上涨，结束了连续三日的跌势，并从16周低点反弹，原因是俄罗斯原油有望受到更严格的制裁，但对欧佩克+下月增产导致供应增加的预期抑制了涨幅。【原文：Oil prices rose on Thursday, snapping a three-day losing streak and rebounding from 16-week lows on prospects of tighter sanctions on Russian crude, though expectations of higher supply from an OPEC+ output boost next month capped gains.】

item.title: 最高法院允许美联储主席库克暂时留任，美元上涨
item.description: 美国最高法院表示将在1月份就唐纳德-特朗普总统试图罢免美联储理事丽莎-库克（Lisa Cook）一案举行听证会，暂时让她留任，此后美元在周四亚洲早盘重新站稳了脚跟。【原文：The U.S. dollar regained its footing in early Asian trading on Thursday after the U.S. Supreme Court said it would hear arguments in January over President Donald Trump's attempt to remove Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, leaving her in the post for now.】

item.title: 阿根廷米莱伊称美国援助谈判包括债务购买和利润分享
item.description: 阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱说，美国对阿根廷的金融支持建议可能包括在二级市场购买该国的债务和利润分享安排。【原文：Argentina's President Javier Milei said proposed U.S. financial support for Argentina could include purchases of the country's debt in the secondary market and a profit-sharing arrangement.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：中国限制在电信网络中使用诺基亚和爱立信
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周三援引熟悉内情的人士的话报道称，中国正在限制在其网络中使用欧洲电信设备供应商诺基亚和爱立信的产品。【原文：China is curbing the use of European telecom kit suppliers Nokia and Ericsson in its networks, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 三星、SK 海力士股价因 OpenAI 合作关系而上涨
item.description: 三星电子和 SK 海力士签署了为 OpenAI 数据中心供应存储芯片的意向书后，这两家韩国芯片制造商的股票周四大涨。【原文：Shares of Samsung Electronics and SK Hynix rallied on Thursday after the South Korean chipmakers signed letters of intent to supply memory chips for OpenAI's data centers.】

item.title: 墨西哥汽车业警告称，USMCA 审查前前景复杂
item.description: 墨西哥汽车业警告说，在 2026 年《美国-墨西哥-加拿大协定》（USMCA）审查之前将面临 "复杂的前景"，汽车业高管们对更严格的原产地规则和对零部件中亚洲成分的审查表示担忧。【原文：Mexico's auto industry warned of a "complex outlook" ahead of the 2026 review of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), with executives citing concerns over tighter rules of origin and scrutiny of Asian content in components.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称中国和马来西亚正在洽谈稀土提炼项目
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士说，中国和马来西亚正在就稀土加工项目进行早期谈判，主权财富基金马来西亚国家矿业公司（Khazanah Nasional）可能与一家中国国有企业合作，在这个东南亚国家建设一座精炼厂。【原文：China and Malaysia are in early talks for a project to process rare earths, with sovereign wealth fund Khazanah Nasional likely to partner with a Chinese state-owned firm to build a refinery in the Southeast Asian nation, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 全州保险公司调整领导层，任命马里奥-里佐为首席运营官
item.description: 全州保险公司周三任命马里奥-里佐为首席运营官，负责财产保险和保障服务业务。【原文：Allstate on Wednesday named Mario Rizzo as chief operating officer, responsible for the property-liability and protection services businesses.】

item.title: 政府停摆导致付款中断，美国农民将承受更多痛苦
item.description: 周三开始的美国联邦政府停摆将停止向农民支付部分款项，并推迟联邦农业贷款的发放，这对在秋收高峰期已经面临作物价格低迷、债务创历史新高和贸易战的生产者来说是最新的打击。【原文：The U.S. federal government shutdown that began Wednesday will halt some payments to farmers and delay access to federal farm loans, the latest blow for producers already facing low crop prices, record-high debts and a trade war at the height of the fall harvest.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，苹果停止对 Vision Pro 的全面改进，专注于人工智能眼镜
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三援引知情人士的话报道，苹果公司已经停止了对其 Vision Pro 头戴式耳机的大修计划，将资源转用于开发可与 Meta Platforms 公司产品相媲美的智能眼镜。【原文：Apple has halted a planned overhaul of its Vision Pro headset to divert resources toward developing smart glasses that can rival products from Meta Platforms , Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 韩国外长称与美国就安全问题达成粗略协议
item.description: 据韩联社报道，韩国外长赵贤表示，韩国和美国在进行关税谈判的同时，已就安全问题达成了一项粗略协议。【原文：South Korean Foreign Minister Cho Hyun said his country and the United States had reached a rough agreement on security in tandem with ongoing tariff negotiations, Yonhap news agency reported.】

item.title: 七国集团表示将针对那些继续增加购买俄罗斯石油的国家
item.description: 七国集团财长周三表示，他们将采取联合措施，针对那些继续增加购买俄罗斯石油的国家和那些为规避制裁提供便利的国家，加大对俄罗斯的压力。【原文：The Group of Seven nations' finance ministers said on Wednesday they will take joint steps to increase pressure on Russia by targeting those who are continuing to increase their purchases of Russian oil and those that are facilitating circumvention.】

item.title: 霍尼韦尔卸下石棉债务以增加现金流
item.description: 霍尼韦尔周三表示，该公司已将其所有的本迪克斯石棉责任以及某些非本迪克斯石棉责任剥离给企业责任收购平台 Delticus。【原文：Honeywell said on Wednesday that it has divested all of its Bendix asbestos liabilities, as well as certain non-Bendix asbestos liabilities, to corporate liability acquisition platform Delticus.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称，雅虎接近达成以 14 亿美元将 AOL 出售给意大利 Bending Spoons 公司的交易
item.description: 四位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，雅虎正在与意大利技术公司 Bending Spoons 就以约 14 亿美元的价格出售美国在线进行深入谈判，阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management）支持的雅虎将甩掉早期互联网时代最知名的公司之一。【原文：Yahoo is in advanced talks to sell AOL to Italian technology company Bending Spoons for about $1.4 billion, four sources familiar with the matter said, as the Apollo Global Management -backed firm sheds one of the most recognizable names of the early internet era.】

item.title: 交易日：关门？股票上涨
item.description: 了解推动全球市场的各种力量。【原文：Making sense of the forces driving global markets.】

item.title: Grindr 任命资深高管约翰-诺斯为财务总监
item.description: 约会应用 Grindr 周三任命约翰-诺斯（John North）为财务总监，接替凡娜-克兰茨（Vanna Krantz）。【原文：Dating app Grindr on Wednesday named John North as its finance chief, replacing Vanna Krantz.】

item.title: 泰森食品公司在最大猪肉价格垄断案中支付 8500 万美元
item.description: 泰森食品公司（Tyson Foods）同意支付 8500 万美元，以了结消费者指控这家美国最大肉类公司与竞争对手合谋，通过限制 200 亿美元美国市场的供应来抬高猪肉价格的诉讼。【原文：Tyson Foods agreed to pay $85 million to settle a lawsuit by consumers who accused the largest U.S. meat company of conspiring with rivals to inflate pork prices by limiting supply in the $20 billion U.S. market.】

item.title: 马斯克成为净资产达到 5000 亿美元的第一人
item.description: 根据福布斯亿万富豪指数，特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周三成为历史上首位净资产达到近 5000 亿美元的人。【原文：Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Wednesday became the first person in history to achieve a net worth of nearly $500 billion, according to Forbes' billionaires index.】

item.title: 美国政府关门带来不确定性，但很少对经济产生持久影响
item.description: 在美联储等政策制定者对美国就业市场的健康状况、通胀轨迹以及消费者支出和企业投资力度存在不确定性和分歧之际，美国政府的停摆为联邦经济数据的流动踩下了刹车。【原文：The U.S. government shutdown has thrown the brakes on the flow of federal economic data at a moment of uncertainty and division among policymakers like those at the Federal Reserve about the health of the U.S. job market, the trajectory of inflation and the strength of consumer spending and business investment.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，KKR 探讨以 70 亿美元出售加拿大彭宾纳天然气基础设施公司的股份
item.description: 四位熟悉内情的人士周三表示，KKR 正在探索出售其在彭比纳天然气基础设施公司（Pembina Gas Infrastructure）40% 股份的可能性，预计其在这家加拿大中游运营商的持股价值约为 70 亿美元。【原文：KKR is exploring a potential sale of its 40% stake in Pembina Gas Infrastructure, with its holding in the Canadian midstream operator expected to be valued at around $7 billion, four people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，亿万富翁阿斯内斯的 AQR 多策略基金 2025 年迄今大涨 15.6
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的人士周三表示，亿万富翁投资者克里夫-阿斯内斯（Cliff Asness）的 AQR 资本管理公司（AQR Capital Management）旗下多只基金在第三季度取得了正收益。【原文：Billionaire investor Cliff Asness's AQR Capital Management finished the third quarter with positive returns in several of its funds, a person familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 白宫警告：如果停摆持续下去，裁员迫在眉睫
item.description: 白宫周三警告说，随着政府关门第一天的到来，裁员迫在眉睫，尽管副总统JD Vance坚称尚未做出最终决定。【原文：The White House warned on Wednesday that worker layoffs are imminent as the first day of the government shutdown unfolded, even as Vice President JD Vance insisted no final decisions have been made.】

item.title: 福特在南非的裁员与英国税收调整和销量下降有关
item.description: 福特汽车南非分公司将裁员计划归因于其 Ranger 皮卡在欧洲的订单减少，原因是英国最近的税收变化以及插电式混合动力 Ranger 车型出口量低迷。【原文：The South African arm of Ford Motor has attributed the planned retrenchments to lower European orders for its Ranger pickup truck, driven by recent tax changes in the UK and sluggish export volumes for its plug-in hybrid Ranger model.】

item.title: 据 Semafor 报道，英特尔正在就将 AMD 增列为代工客户进行早期谈判
item.description: 据 Semafor 周三援引熟悉内情的人士的话报道，英特尔正在就将 AMD 增列为代工客户进行早期谈判。【原文：Intel is in early talks to add AMD as a foundry customer, Semafor reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 惠誉：美国政府关门短期内不太可能影响主权评级
item.description: 惠誉周三表示，预计美国政府目前的停摆不会在短期内影响到美国的主权评级，并补充说，对经济增长的任何影响都将取决于停摆的范围和持续时间。【原文：Fitch said on Wednesday it does not expect the ongoing U.S. government shutdown to affect the country's sovereign ratings in the near term, adding that any impact on economic growth would depend on its scope and duration.】

item.title: 在加拿大央行 9 月 17 日利率决议之前，委员们预计他们可能会在 10 月货币政策报告中提出对经济增长和通货膨胀的基线预测 - 讨论纪要
item.description: 这是一条突发新闻。全面报道将很快发布。【原文：This is a breaking news story. Full coverage will be available soon.】

item.title: First Brands 获得破产法官批准 5 亿美元救援融资
item.description: 破产汽车供应商 First Brands 周三获得了美国法官的许可，可以进行 11 亿美元破产贷款的第一阶段工作，在该公司努力重组长期债务的同时，可立即获得 5 亿美元的资金注入。【原文：Bankrupt auto supplier First Brands on Wednesday received a U.S. judge's permission to proceed with the first phase of a $1.1 billion bankruptcy loan, giving the company an immediate infusion of $500 million as it tries to reorganize its longer-term debt.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，人工智能数据分析初创公司 Dataiku 已选定在美国上市的银行
item.description: 据知情人士透露，人工智能数据分析初创公司 Dataiku 已聘请投资银行推进首次公开募股。【原文：Dataiku, an artificial intelligence data analytics startup, has hired investment banks to push ahead with an initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.】
